Generation II.Gold: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet .
Generation II.Silver: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine 's underside to scavenge for leftovers.
Generation II.Crystal: To escape from an attacker, it may shoot water out of its mouth, then use that force to swim backward.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine 's underside to scavenge for leftovers. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this Pok é mon travels downstream from rivers.
Generation III.Sapphire: Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this Pok é mon travels downstream from rivers.
Generation III.Emerald: A Remoraid uses its abdominal muscles to forcefully expel swallowed water, then shoot down flying prey. When evolution approaches, it travels down rivers.
Generation III.FireRed: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine 's underside to scavenge for leftovers.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 100 yards .

Generation IV.Diamond: It squirts water forcefully from its mouth to shoot down flying prey.
Generation IV.Pearl: It clings to Mantine to feed on the big Pokémon's scraps. This is an adaptation to avoid foes.
Generation IV.Platinum: It forcefully squirts water. The water jet never misses prey even if the Remoraid is deep in the sea.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It has superb accuracy. The water it shoots out can strike moving prey from more than 300 feet away.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine 's underside to scavenge for leftovers.

Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this Pokémon travels downstream from rivers.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: This Pokémon clings to Mantine and shares in its prosperity. When its Mantine is attacked, Remoraid will fight alongside it!
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Also known as the "sniper of the seas," its water gun can hit prey without fail from over 300 feet away.

Generation VIII.Sword: The water they shoot from their mouths can hit moving prey from more than 300 feet away.
Generation VIII.Shield: Using its dorsal fin as a suction pad, it clings to a Mantine's underside to scavenge for leftovers.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It squirts water forcefully from its mouth to shoot down flying prey.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It clings to Mantine to feed on the big Pokémon's scraps. This is an adaptation to avoid foes.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Spits water from its mouth with incredible accuracy. It captures Burmy by shooting them down off the branches from which they dangle.
